programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Jarrod and Brandi discover their latest purchase could be worth $25,000, while Darrell buys some video game memorabilia.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team members are intrigued when 18th-century engravings of the Spanish Armada arrive at the shop, along with explicit wax recordings from the 1890s.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team test drives a 1950s Chrysler Town & Country Newport, and a cubist painting by New Zealand artist Louise Henderson arrives at the shop.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les tries to prove to his staff that he is still an integral part of the pawn business after he makes a series of bad purchases.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.sub-title: To Catch a Thief - Part One
programme.desc: Part one of two. Les is horrified when he discovers the shop has been broken into and the security system has been disabled, so he sets out to try to catch the thief.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick Dale fixes up a strength-tester from an arcade and a tiny vending machine.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick turns a 1930s refrigerator into a wine box, while the team tries to fix a coffee machine from the 1950s.

programme.title: Pirate Treasure of the Knights Templar
programme.desc: The trail leads to India where Barry Clifford checks out an island that may contain the most fabled Templar treasure - the Flaming Cross of Goa.

programme.title: Unusual Suspects
programme.desc: The police investigation to find the Texas nightclub robber who left one person dead and two critically wounded.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The bidders attend auctions in Cedar Hill, where they compete over voodoo statues, boxes of barbecue sauce and prosthetic limbs from the American Civil War.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The bidders compete over collectible dolls, antiques and a strange coin, which supposedly has the means to prevent the end of the world.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts another round of the peculiar panel quiz and finds out how much Professor Brian Cox, Rhys Darby, Jason Manford and regular panellist Alan Davies know about justice, awarding points for the most interesting answers.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Guests James Acaster, Dane Baptiste, Rob Beckett, Ed Byrne and Holly Walsh join host Dara O Briain and regular Hugh Dennis for the topical comedy show, looking back at events from July 2016 through the medium of games and discussion.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts another round of the peculiar panel quiz and finds out how much Julian Clary, Ross Noble, Bill Bailey and regular panellist Alan Davies know about jumpers, awarding points for the most interesting answers.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts another round of the peculiar panel quiz and finds out how much Professor Brian Cox, Rhys Darby, Jason Manford and regular panellist Alan Davies know about justice, awarding points for the most interesting answers.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Anita Rani, Chris Ramsey, Janet Ellis and Jamie Theakston test their general knowledge skills in a variety of entertaining trivia-based games.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Guests James Acaster, Dane Baptiste, Rob Beckett, Ed Byrne and Holly Walsh join host Dara O Briain and regular Hugh Dennis for the topical comedy show, looking back at events from July 2016 through the medium of games and discussion.

programme.title: The Indestructibles
programme.desc: Multi-terrain board sports push Tim and Gendle to their limits, including high speed slaloms and an attempt at the world's first dry ski loop the loop.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Keith engages in a high-speed pursuit after spotting a car being driven with a flat tyre. Even after the tyre disintegrates at 90mph, the driver still refuses to stop.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank visit a contact living in Sicily, who offers to show them around a treasure-filled house.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: The bidders head to Marina del Rey, California, in search of nautical equipment.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Scott goes all out to win at an auction, while Lori and Chrissy clash.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The duo travel to London, where they consider buying a rare motorbike and a telephone box with a risque history.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank find a rare comic-book and visit a house that is believed to be haunted.

programme.title: Sin City Motors
programme.desc: Reality TV show following the exploits of eccentric master fabricator Steve Darnell, who invites cameras into his workshop as he builds customised cars from junk.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and James May take a look at increasingly popular tall hatchbacks known as crossovers. Having concluded their primary appeal is to caravanners, the duo spend a couple of days in models by Mazda and Volkswagen and try to get a feel for what life is like for the people they believe would buy one. Meanwhile, Richard Hammond drives a pair of exciting Lamborghinis in Italy - the ferocious Aventador Roadster and the limited-edition Sesto Elemento, which carries an eye-watering price tag of around £2million. Two cars are also put through their paces on the test track, with James in a modern re-creation of the classic Porsche 911 and Aerosmith frontman Steven Tyler in the rather less exotic Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: CS gas is used to stop a crazed axeman, a drunk student cannot understand why he's being arrested and a joker insults a cop but uses his charm to avoid arrest.

programme.title: Sin City Motors
programme.desc: Reality TV show following the exploits of eccentric master fabricator Steve Darnell. He and the gang turn a Chevy C10 into a monster of a car, complete with scars and rivets.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson drives the Jaguar F-Type sports car on some of Britain's finest roads, while Richard Hammond jumps inside the Range Rover Sport and gives it a thorough workout off-road, on a track and in what he believes is its most natural habitat - the lanes of Cheshire. James May goes for a countryside adventure in the New Routemaster London bus brought into use in 2013, which is propelled by a turbodiesel generator and a powerful electric motor. Inspired by the machines they have tested, the trio then meet to celebrate Britain's motor industry with a grand finale in front of Buckingham Palace. Plus, former Formula One driver Mark Webber takes to the track for a lap in the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson attempts to build a car that is even smaller than the Peel P50 and then tests it out on the streets of London before pitching his concept in the Dragons' Den. James May puts the Bentley Continental GT Speed through its paces by taking it on a rally stage, while Richard Hammond drives the new Pagani Huayra hypercar before handing it over to the Stig. Actor Damian Lewis goes for a spin in the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Bill Bailey, Colin Lane and Desiree Burch join regular panellist Alan Davies to answer host Sandi Toksvig's questions on the theme 'Overseas', in an extended edition of the unorthodox quiz. During the course of the show, the panellists find out about Allotment Annies as well as who keeps their brothers in a cage. The fiendishly difficult questions lead to points being awarded for the answers the questionmaster considers most interesting, though not necessarily correct.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Anita Rani, Chris Ramsey, Janet Ellis and Jamie Theakston test their general knowledge skills in a variety of entertaining trivia-based games this week.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Comedians Dave Gorman and Omid Djalili, TV presenter Davina McCall and journalist Janet Street-Porter join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the comedy panel show, in which they try to dupe their opponents with plausible lies about themselves. Presented by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Olympic cycling gold-medallist Chris Hoy, impressionist Ronni Ancona, writer and producer Danny Wallace and sports presenter Gabby Logan join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the comedy panel show, in which they try to dupe their opponents with plausible lies about themselves. Hosted by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Micky Flanagan, Jason Byrne and Seann Walsh
programme.desc: Micky Flanagan hosts the stand-up show recorded at London's Hammersmith Apollo, introducing routines by Jason Byrne and Seann Walsh, with all three sharing their comical observations on life.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: David Baddiel steers some heavy machinery toward a representation of his childhood sweetheart, in the hope of impressing Taskmaster Greg Davies.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts another round of the peculiar panel quiz and asks a range of unusual questions about jobs, finding out how much Sarah Millican, David Mitchell, the Rev Richard Coles and regular panellist Alan Davies know about the subject.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts a Christmas edition of the peculiar panel quiz, asking Sarah Millican, Phill Jupitus, Danny Baker and regular panellist Alan Davies a range of questions on the suitably festive topic of jingle bells, awarding points for the most interesting answers.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Godber is feeling dejected after his romantic fortunes take a turn for the worse, so Fletch tries to revive his friend's flagging spirits. However, his cunning plan has one potential drawback - it involves his own daughter. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletcher and the rest of Slade's inmates take advantage of the relaxed atmosphere - and of Barrowclough - with Mackay away on holiday. Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale star.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: British bombers are unable to hit their targets precisely and attack German cities under cover of darkness, while the Blitz in Britain brings public demand for revenge strikes, and Arthur Harris takes charge of Bomber Command.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: Examining a fleet of cruise ships that are the largest passenger vessels in the world, and revealing how they have built on 19th-century experiments in hydrodynamics.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: Jardine and Taggart investigate the murder of a pensioner, focusing their inquiries on his daughter and son-in-law. Unfortunately, the case soon takes an unexpected turn. Glasgow-set detective drama, starring Mark McManus and Blythe Duff.

programme.title: The Lost World
programme.desc: Trapped on the plateau, Edward, Agnes and Lord Roxton set out in search of professors Challenger and Summerlee, following their capture by the strange apemen who may provide the missing link between modern man and prehistoric life. But when they mount a rescue, the explorers are confronted by a native tribe. Conclusion of the adventure, starring Bob Hoskins, Peter Falk and James Fox.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Bramwell
programme.desc: Period medical drama chronicling the personal and professional consequences of Eleanor Bramwell's determined quest to become the first female surgeon at the East London Hospital. Jemma Redgrave stars.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Mark and Cate's new baby falls ill, which prompts a revelation from Cate. Meanwhile, Butcher and Stacey grow closer when he rescues a soldier.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: The hunt for Abi Nixon's kidnapper takes on renewed urgency when it appears she is being held captive in a sealed container with only a couple of hours' oxygen left. Psychological profiler Dr Hugh Wallis reckons the taunting messages sent by the culprit point to an old adversary with a grudge, and soon pinpoints a likely suspect, while Phil offers the distraught Sam solace in her darkest hour.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Rosie suffers complications with her pregnancy and has to undergo an emergency Caesarean, but the outcome has heartbreaking repercussions for all concerned. Jess tries to get out of her quandary by telling Sean she is going to have an abortion, though he begs her not to go through with it. Connie suspends Will after he unwittingly talks to a journalist about the canteen strike he caused.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: A man fractures his right leg in two places and cracks a rib after the walls of a well fall onto him. Tragedy strikes after Josh is asked to attend a fire at his own home, while Matt hands in his resignation and makes plans to move to Crete.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Samantha is appalled when it becomes clear that psychological profiler Dr Hugh Wallis has brainwashed Abi, who not only refuses to name him as her kidnapper but agrees to return home with him. The situation becomes even more dire when Peter Baxter is charged with the abduction, leaving Samantha wondering how she can convince her colleagues of the terrible truth. Meanwhile, sexy new recruit PC Amber Johannsen turns heads at Sun Hill, although Gina is unimpressed by her slipshod approach to police work, and Ramani crosses swords with an abusive wife and mother.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Ian entertains an important business client, while Pat sets Frank a daunting task.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Dot fears the launderette has been broken into, Ian is looking troubled, Clyde and Hattie are sure that Lloyd is up to no good, while Frank makes Dot an offer she cannot refuse.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: A dramatic warehouse fire in London requires every fire squad in the area to deal, leaving the rest of the city vulnerable to unfortunate mishaps. The Blue Watch team is called in to deal with such an emergency when a nuclear fuel train comes to a stop, and Tate makes a frightening discovery.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Left to look after Felsham Hall until it has been sold, Lovejoy uses the house as a furniture showroom. It seems unlikely anyone could replace Lady Jane in the dodgy dealer's affections - but that doesn't prevent his eye being caught by glamorous auctioneer Charlotte Cavendish. Charlie Gimbert eventually buys the property, and agrees to rent the stables for Lovejoy Antiques. Patricia Hayes guest stars in an episode directed by Ian McShane.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: A pair of rich fashion designers are too preoccupied to realise their child's nanny is not all she seems. When their worst nightmare comes true and their baby is abducted, it is up to Jim to track them down. John Nettles stars, with Sheila Ruskin and Duncan Preston.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Aveline bares all for the front cover of a magazine, Adrian finds himself out of a job and a card game leaves Freddie £500 in debt.

programme.title: Are You Being Served?
programme.desc: The gang visits 10 Downing Street to campaign against a Japanese takeover - and Mrs Slocombe gets a chance to demonstrate that Britain has women even more formidable than Mrs Thatcher. Comedy, starring Mollie Sugden and John Inman.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean searches for a manager to run the agency, while Lionel gets to work on the outline for an American mini-series based on their real-life romance. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Smiler reminisces about a woman who escaped his advances during the war without leaving her contact details, so Truly, Alvin and Billy volunteer to track her down - even though it means a foray into hostile territory. Long-running comedy series, starring Frank Thornton, Brian Murphy, Keith Clifford and Stephen Lewis.

programme.title: Hetty Wainthropp Investigates
programme.desc: A concerned mother hires Hetty to find out who is stalking her daughter just days before her wedding. It's not long before the unlikely sleuth is on the trail of a disgraced soldier with a grudge against the father of the bride-to-be. Light-hearted drama, starring Patricia Routledge and Derek Benfield.

programme.title: Ms Fisher's Modern Murder Mysteries
programme.desc: Spin-off from Miss Fisher's Murder Mysteries, set in the 1960s, following Miss Fisher's niece, who sets out to investigate what happened to her aunt. In the first of a two-part story, Peregrine Fisher arrives in Melbourne to collect her inheritance from her aunt, Phryne Fisher. Wanting to be part of the same Adventuresses' Club as her aunt, Peregrine decides to follow in Phryne's footsteps and solve the murder of a dead model at a bridal fashion show. Geraldine Hakewill stars.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: A skeleton uncovered in the foundations of a swimming pool is identified as a young lottery winner named Cheryl, who was reported missing 17 years ago. The prime suspects are her fellow quiz team-mates, who won their lucky windfall as part of a syndicate, and while some have put their money to good use, the victim's boyfriend has fallen on hard times and the media remain convinced he is the key to her murder. As allegations of affairs, fights and betrayal begin to surface, the team is left to ponder whether money really is the root of all evil.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. A body is discovered in the boot of a vehicle that has just been through the car crusher, presenting Taggart and Jardine with a case that seems to connect the worlds of drug dealers and artists. Mark McManus and James Macpherson star.

programme.title: White House Farm
programme.desc: Stan and his number two Mick Clark speak to Jeremy and relatives of the murdered family, but their picture of what really happened at White House Farm remains inconclusive. The twins' father Colin Caffell is devastated by his loss, and is initially comforted by Jeremy, while post-mortem examinations reveal nothing to contradict the murder-suicide theory. Meanwhile, relative Ann Eaton cannot believe Sheila was responsible, and discusses her growing suspicions with her brother David Boutflour.

programme.title: James Martin's French Adventure
programme.desc: The chef travels through France to visit the locations that inspired his culinary career, beginning at the Chateau Cheval Blanc in Saint-Emilion, before going back to the kitchens of the Hostellerie de Plaisance, where he worked as a lad more than 30 years ago. He rounds off his trip by cooking at an award-winning vineyard.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Entertainment, current affairs and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories and celebrity gossip. Presented by Lorraine Kelly.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: A mix of celebrity chat, lifestyle features, advice and competitions.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Another helping of topical studio discussion from a female perspective, featuring celebrity interviews.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: David Dickinson and the team visit the seaside town of Bridlington in East Yorkshire, where Alys Dobbie goes on a fishing expedition and Tim Hogarth considers opening a toy shop.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Five friends calling themselves Izzet Izzet Wicked answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Game show, hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh asks the questions as contestants Andy, Carol, Ellie and Neil pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: During the opening day of Hawkford Outdoor Pursuits, Charity and Vanessa have plans, while Ryan makes a decision.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Tyrone and Fiz are horrified to discover the back door unlocked and Hope gone. Tim's shocked to find Charlie on his doorstep, and she tells him he can forget about the divorce as she cannot afford the legal fees. Bethany is gutted when Alya reveals that Ray has made her the bistro's new manager.

programme.title: Bradley Walsh & Son: Breaking Dad
programme.desc: For the next leg of their journey, Bradley and Barney visit the Red River Gorge in Kentucky, before heading to the supposedly haunted Poasttown Elementary School in Middletown, Ohio. The next day, they travel to Louisville, birthplace of legendary boxer Muhammad Ali, where they follow in his footsteps by sparring at the local boxing gym. At the end of a long day, Barney rewards his dad with a well-earned meal at a KFC restaurant in Kentucky - the home state of the chain's founder Colonel Harland Sanders.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Fiz shows the police the passports and ferry tickets, convinced Jade has abducted Hope. Carla tells an appalled Bethany how Ray made Michelle sign a gagging order, and Charlie returns to No 4 with her bags and explains she's been evicted.

programme.title: White House Farm
programme.desc: After a vital discovery at the farm, Stan and Mick feel closer to shoring up their own suspicions about Jeremy. The arrival of Brett, a friend from New Zealand (played by Game of Thrones star Alfie Allen), increases tensions between Jeremy and Julie, while Ann grows ever more alarmed and suspicious of her cousin Jeremy's behaviour, and his handling of the family estate. As preparations for the inquest continue, Stan is concerned that if the bodies are released for cremation, vital evidence will be lost for ever.

programme.title: Scotland Tonight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's headlines from a Scottish perspective, plus local news from Aberdeen, Edinburgh and Glasgow.

programme.title: Peston
programme.desc: Political magazine show presented by Robert Peston, featuring major interviews with MPs, topical guests and cultural figures. Including updates from social media taking in perspectives from viewers, experts and key players throughout the programme.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: A look at the process of forging super steel to make cars lighter, greener and safer, and how Australia's 80 million sheep are sheared every spring.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer tries to get his hands on one of his dad's favourites - a Ford Popular, a car known for being variable in its quality.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini takes his newly restored 1964 Ferrari Lusso and 1957 Mercedes 300SL Gullwing to an auction in Scottsdale.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini visits the collection of deceased car dealer Lee Roy Hartung and finds original motorcycles at an auction.

programme.title: World's Deadliest Drivers
programme.desc: More than 50 million people are injured every year on the roads, sparking a boom in dashboard cameras that has captured a wealth of fascinating and surprising footage.

programme.title: World's Deadliest Drivers
programme.desc: More than 50 million people are injured every year on the roads, sparking a boom in dashboard cameras that capture a wealth of fascinating and surprising footage.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: A racing car slams into a wall at 100mph, homes are destroyed by 260mph winds, a 70-year-old pilot crashes his plane, and a van collides with a police car.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: How a freight train smashed into an articulated lorry, the collapse of a four-storey building, a motorcycle crash, and the collision of a house and a bridge during floods.

programme.title: Extreme Loggers
programme.desc: Lumberjacks in Alberta, Canada, construct an ice bridge to help transport the timber to the mill, but increasing temperatures and equipment failures threaten their efforts.

programme.title: Overhaulin'
programme.desc: A woman calls on the team's expertise to transform her husband's 1967 Dodge A-100 truck, which was passed on to him by his late father.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: A look at ways to weave an authentic Turkish carpet, and how helicopter blade technology is being used to make cross country skis. Plus, the practicalities behind the Niagara Falls.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard's artisan restorers rescue a ravaged carousel horse dating from before the First World War. Plus, they revive a valuable 1930s sofa and a 100-year-old weathervane.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: The captain of the Rollo is furious to discover a miscalculation led to his crew overfishing, meaning they caught 40,000lbs more crab than their licence permits.

programme.title: Gold Divers
programme.desc: Captain Scott Meisterheim swallows his pride and invites Steve Riedel to rejoin the Wild Ranger crew, while the Sluicey finally enjoys some success.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Sharon has to move a copper mountain, Sludge must shift a freight of highly flammable liquid, and mobile butcher Larry tries to save his meat from the heat.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer and mechanic Edd China decide to create an eye-catching, inexpensive beach cruiser, as they aim to restore a classic Chevy Corvair to its former glory.

programme.title: Supertruckers
programme.desc: Steve and Sam get into deep trouble transporting a state-of-the-art Navy mine sweeper, while Simon has his hands full cleaning up after moving a 40-tonne vehicle.

programme.title: Secrets of the Underground
programme.desc: New theories claim the sunken city of Atlantis may have been in the Americas. From the Bahamas to an ancient site in Louisiana, Rob and Stefan seek the evidence.

programme.title: Railroad Australia
programme.desc: A traffic jam splits a town in half, causing trouble for veteran driver Bernie Baker. Plus, trainee Allie Hume is working hard to pass her final drivers' exams.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: The fleet pushes operations into overdrive as the end of the season approaches, but another challenge begins as soon as the job comes to an end. Meanwhile, the Northwestern returns to Seattle, where all the families are waiting, and Edgar meets his son for the first time.

programme.title: Gold Divers
programme.desc: The crews make the most of the last few days of the season as winter descends on Nome, before facing off at an auction for next year's dredging grounds.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard and sidekick Tee are on a buying trip in Germany. They trade with counts and barons and meet characters as quirky as the antiques they're potentially selling.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Turbo pushes his luck, and his truck, as he tries to go the distance and deliver his load, while Bob tackles a mountain of timber.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer tries to get his hands on one of his dad's favourites - a Ford Popular, a car known for being variable in its quality.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: The restorers face a challenge with Chesterfield sofa rescued from the scrapheap. Plus, they set out to revive a shattered marble figurine and a broken French bakery counter.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard examines furniture in a Black Country factory. Next, in Derby, a new contact pays off when he finds the crankshaft from a Battle of Britain fighter plane.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Classic Cars
programme.desc: Salvage aficionado Drew Pritchard and Turbo Pickers' Paul Cowland head to the Midlands to look at a Swedish classic - the Volvo Amazon. When Paul falls for an early Toyota MR2, he seeks a way to convince Drew it will turn a profit.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Simon O'Brien recycles some historic oak while Henry Cole comes unstuck when he tries to get to grips with an old Ford Escort.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The technological processes involved in keeping people comfortable, entertained and safe with the latest aircraft seats, and a look at the design of bras with aerospace technology.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How plasterboard is made from power station smoke, the casting of the world's top awards, and how planes are built that can take off and land almost anywhere.

programme.title: FBI Case Files
programme.desc: An infant's body is found in a box in a waterway. As detectives search for the killer, families wait anxiously for the victim's identity to be confirmed.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: The role of DNA and ballistics reports in helping to solve the murder of a Swedish man whose body was found in a wood.

programme.title: Copycat Killers
programme.desc: How brothers Lyle and Erik Menendez were adversely influenced by the 1987 film Billionaire Boys Club. In the wake of their rich parents' murder, the pair went on a spending spree, buying businesses, fast cars and travelling all over the world. A breakthrough came when police got a tip that Lyle had confessed to killing his parents to his psychologist.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: A case from Claypool Hill, Virginia, where a popular pizza restaurant was turned into a horrific crime scene. The clues pointed to something more sinister than a robbery gone wrong, and authorities realised they had to move quickly to catch the killer.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: Agents and members of the public become involved in the search for an eight-year-old girl who has been abducted.

programme.title: Animal Cops Philadelphia
programme.desc: The vets try to save a Doberman Pinscher's leg after it is found with its nails growing into the pads of its feet.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown turns his attention to an amorous rabbit, a malnourished platypus and a pet that has escaped multiple times.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: That Looks Like a Torture Device
programme.desc: A bride preparing to marry professional snowboarder Scott Lago brings an entourage to the store with her, but finds they disagree with her opinions.
